doc.title: 3Q guidance in line; solid execution seen in auto/communication; lift PO; reiterate Buy
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/BofA/3Q guidance in line solid execution seen in autocommunication lift PO reiterate Buy3Q guidance in line solid execution s_2025-08-28

passages.text: Reiterate Rating: BUY | PO: 50.00 CNY | Price: 44.98 CNY

2Q earnings came in line with BofA/consensus at CNY3.6bn (+18% QoQ, +23% YoY), and at the guided mid- point. Sales were 8% below BofAe but in line with consensus at CNY62.7bn (+2% QoQ, +23% YoY). OPM missed BofAe/consensus by 0.2ppt/0.7ppt at 4.6%, flat QoQ/YoY. Luxshare guided 3Q earnings will grow 15- 28% YoY, indicating mid- point at CNY4.5bn (+24% QoQ, +22% YoY), in line with BofAe but 7% above consensus.

We expect Apple business to remain relatively stable near- term as concerns about tariff have largely eased. More importantly, we see a strong delivery in auto/communication business, as 1H revenue increased by 82%/49% YoY, respectively. Management remains confident on growth sustainability, and believe its dependency on key consumer electronics customer will further decline from 65% (1Q25 mix). For auto, management noted previously secured projects across auto electronics to auto parts have started contribution. Also, synergy with Leoni after consolidation looks better than expected, and Leoni is likely to beat mgmt. expectation in terms of profit delivery. For communication, Luxshare noted 60% of the growth this year will be contributed by cable/connector and the rest 40% aided by power/thermal. Meanwhile, a key single customer will be the major driver behind the growth. In our view, this proved Luxshare's execution in Al server, and the strong Al capex should continue to drive its growth.

We fine- tune 2025E earnings to factor in guidance and lift 2026- 27E earnings by 5- 6% to reflect a positive outlook in auto/communication. We lift our PO to CNY50 (18x 2026E P/E) from CNY42 (18x 2H25- 1H26E P/E) after the valuation base rollover. We reiterate Buy on Luxshare, given the firm's quality expansion into non- consumer electronics.

Company DescriptionLuxshare is one of the top 10 connector suppliers and also a key lightning cable provider for Apple with \(55\% +\) share. Around \(80\%\) of its sales is from consumer segment, followed by \(6\%\) from computing and \(5\% /8\%\) from automotive / communication segment. In addition to Apple, its key customers include Huawei, MSFT, HP, Dell, Lenovo.

Investment RationaleWe have a Buy rating on Luxshare given our view that (1) it will likely increase its component supply with Apple to acoustic, haptic, wireless charging, and LCP antenna at the expense of peers, from original cable/connector business, (2) rising assembly share in AirPods/Apple Watch, and (3) connector business benefit from China's localization.
Exhibit 1: 2Q25 earnings review 2Q earnings in line with BofA/consensus at CNY3.6bn (+18% QoQ,+23%YoY at the guided mid-point
Source: Company data, BofA Global Research estimates, Bloomberg consensus
Exhibit 2:3Q25 earnings guidance
Source: Company data, BofA Global Research estimates, Bloomberg consensus
Exhibit 3: Earnings estimate change, 2025-27E We fine-tune 2025E earnings to factor in guidance and lift 2026-27E earnings by 5-6% to reflect positive outlook in auto/communication
Source: BofA Global Research estimates
Exhibit 4: BofAe vs consensus, 2025-27E Our 2025-27E earnings are largely in line with consensus
Source: BofA Global Research estimates, Bloomberg consensus
Exhibit 5: Luxshare's quarterly income statement, 2024-27E We model 24% earnings CAGR in 2025-27E
Source: Company data, BofA Global Research estimates

We set our price objective at CNY50, based on 18x 2026E P/E. We use 18x (slightly below - 0.55D of Luxshare's historical trading average since 2015 when it became a key Apple supplier), to reflect solid earnings delivery backed by its share gain at iPhone assembly and long- term upside from auto/communication and Android ODM business. 18x also reflects Luxshare's less competitive edge compared to Hon Hai in iPhone assembly expanding to India.

Downside risks are: (1) unexpected hiccups in assembly, (2) the company increasing opex/capex for new business expansion, (3) continuous deterioration in iPhone shipment, and (4) worsened US/China relationship.
Upside risks to our PO are: (1) stronger iPhone volumes, (2) faster share gains at AirPods and Apple Watch, (3) earlier entry into iPhone assembly, and (4) eased tension between China and US
